metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15121 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: In radare2 before version 4.5.0, malformed PDB file names in the PDB serverpath cause shell injection. To trigger the problem it's required to openthe executable in radare2 and run idpd to trigger the download. The shellcode will execute, and will create a file called pwned in the currentdirectory.

criterions.comment: radare2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
